result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lynn A. Thomas

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. No drug paraphernalia. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Tracey L. The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's T.L's residence within 72 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

Defendant Lynn A. Thomas in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.
Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. No drug paraphernalia. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Tracey L. The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's T.L's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

1:58 PM
Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Victim: TL. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am. $2000 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). ec
